Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: [catching Jim looking at him at Pam's desk] What?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, nothing.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Pam's on vacation and she gets back tomorrow, so it'll be nice to see her. It'll be nice, and, uh, she set a date for the wedding with Roy. Uh... June. Summer. So, that'll be nice. And that's that.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: [again catching Jim looking at him] What?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, nothing.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Jim's been looking at me kind of a lot all week. I would be creeped out by it, but it's nothing compared to the way Michael looks at me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Spamster!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Um, Pam plus Spam plus...?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hamster.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Right.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Welcome back! How was your vacation?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It was great.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Mm-hm.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Did you get lucky? Oh! Boink!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Roy and I just got back from the Poconos. I get ten vacation days a year, and I try to hold off taking them for as long as possible, and this year I got to the third week in January.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I am Pam. Spicoli guy. Oh, God. Names, numbers. Okay. [walking into office] Whoa! God! Yuck, yuck. Yuck. Yuck!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wow! What happened in there?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I don't know.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: There is stink in there, my God! What is... what is that?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [looking at pile on Michel's carpet] Oh... I don't know.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Is it a bird?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, I don't think it's a bird.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, God! How could that happen? How could... right in the middle of the carpet.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: What's goin' on?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Um, somebody vomited right in the middle of the carpet in my office.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [taking a look] I don't think that's vomit.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Check it out.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Me?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Check it out. Don't be a wuss, just get... no, I'm not holding your coffee.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Oh, that's ridiculous.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What is it?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Michael. [tapping on door]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What is it? No, just tell me what it is.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [pounding on door] Michael, I ... I ... I gotta get outta here. I can't hold my breath that long.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Open the door up!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: It smelled terrible.

Quote.Speaker: Pam and others
Quote.Text: [after going in to check out the smell] Phew. Oh! No, mm-mm. [leaving quickly]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I cannot believe a pipe burst and left that in there.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: That's no burst pipe.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: How do you know that? What is it, then?

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Hi guys. Somebody makin' soup?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [as cleaning lady with mask leaves] Here she comes. All cleaned? Great. [walks into office]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [coughing] It's still stinky.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That is worse.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: She probably scrubbed it into the fibers of the carpet. Total permeation.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [while in his reeking office] I am a big Fear Factor fan. I'm a big fan of anything Joe Rogan does, actually, so this is sort of like my audition tape. Um... [clearing throat] I can't stand it [gets up to leave], I can't stay in here another second. No!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey! Welcome back!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Thanks!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So, how was the resort? Did you ski a lot?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: A little.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Good! What's goin' on here?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What? I did not do that. That sounds disgusting.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: [barely stifling laughter] It wasn't me. Um... it wasn't me. [regaining composure] It was not me.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [smelling the stink] Oh. Wow.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [giggles at Roy]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [sitting at Jim's desk] Hey Jim. I thought that we would be desk buddies while they changed my carpet.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That might be a little difficult with the one computer.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh... It's ...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: But there's definitely a desk open in the back.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [reluctantly] Yeah ...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: ...which I guess I'll be taking.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no, no! Seriously, I don't mind sharing.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, no, no, seriously, I'll be in the back.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, Kelly.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Are you moving back here?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Um, just for the day while Michael's at my desk.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Because Toby used to sit there, but he had to move over there because of an allergy.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Allergy to... the desk?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: [shaking head] Weird.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [putting his feet on desk] Yeah, yeah, yeah. Old bullpen.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [putting his feet on desk] Ha ha ha... the old bullpen.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Don't ape me.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: This is great.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: The pressures of my office are insane.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [agreeing] Mm.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I just... you couldn't understand, but man, you guys have it so easy out here, you know? I used to sit right here.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No way!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: And who had your office?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ed Truck. [exclaiming is disgust] Ed Truck was the manager before me. Horrible. He hated fun. It was like, "Oh, Ed Truck is walking toward us. Stop having fun. Start pretending to do work." What a jerk. He's... You know what? I swore to myself that if I ever got to walk around the room as manager, people would laugh when they saw me coming and would applaud as I walked away.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: [to Jim] I'm serious. My closet doors will not shut. I mean, it only takes so long to measure to make sure that clothes will hang up because aren't all hangers like that big? So I don't understand why the closet engineer didn't think of that. So now I'm doing this new thing where I just leave piles of clothes on the floor and then I walk around the piles to get an outfit...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know who used to sit at that desk?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That guy Miles who quit to form his own company?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mm-mm. Todd Packer.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I thought he was out on the road.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: He was, but, uh... that desk was empty. He'd come in and sit there sometimes.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: When I was in training, many years ago... not so long ago... I worked side-by-side with a fellow named Todd Packer, and together we rocked the office [picture behind Michael falls]. Packer and I once spent the whole day with our pants off, and when people noticed, we convinced them that they were crazy.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I will gladly pay you Tuesday for a hamburger today.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: [on phone] Excuse me one second, please. [to Michael] What is it that you need right now that you can't wait until I'm off the phone with a customer?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, a customer, well, sound the alarm. [laughs] Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Another time, Packer held this guy's head in the toilet for like a minute. Guy had no sense of humor about it. Probably why he wasn't hired.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: [after Michael punches him in the arm] What did you hit me for?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Charley horse!

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Charley horse!

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: You shouldn't have hit me, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, okay. Gah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Once, as a joke, Packer banged every chick in the office. [giggles] It was hysterical.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: [to Jim] Beyonce, pink the color, Pink the person, hot dogs, basically anything that is awesome. Snow cones...

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Hey Jim, Michael wanted me to ask you how to raise your desk chair.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: It's the lever on the side.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: That's what I told him. Thanks. [leaves]

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Oh my God, he is so cute! Would you talk to him for me and see if he likes me?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, I don't think I can...

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Oh, please Jim? Please, please, Jim. Please, please, please? He's so cute. I like him so much. And I would do it, but I'm too shy. Please, Jim, please, please, please, please, Jim. Please, please, please...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [whispering] Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [whispering] Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Let's send up Accounting.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Old fashioned raid. Sales on Accounting. Yeah. Follow my lead.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey guys.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Hey, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ahem. What's up?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Hey, Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Michael and Dwight
Quote.Text: [as they throw accountants' files and supplies around] Ahhhh! Whoo hoo! Come on, come on, come on, come on! Sales rules!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah! [laughing]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah! Oh ho ho [laughing]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Should we help 'em pick up their stuff?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no, no, no. We don't do that. We don't do that.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Watch out, Pam. You're next!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You're gonna throw my things on the ground?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Maybe!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: What happened in Michael's office was wrong. I understand it [chuckles], it makes sense [regains composure] But it... it was still wrong.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Why would somebody ruin a perfectly good carpet? I don't know. It could be done out of hate. It could be done out of love. It could be completely neutral. Maybe somebody hates the cleaning lady. And, well, she doesn't do a very good job, obviously, because my office still reeks like you would not believe. I hate her.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know what? I am beginning to think that what happened to my carpet was an act of terrorism against the office. The only thing that makes any sense.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [on phone] Hello, am I the 107th caller? [hangs up, dials again] Hello, Rock 107. Am I the 107th caller? [hangs up and dials again] Hell , Rock 107. Am I the 107th caller? [hangs up and begins to dial again] I'm totally gonna win us that box set.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Stop.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Jethro Tull...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Stop it. [Dwight hangs up] Stop. It. [Dwight beings to dial] Don't. Don't.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I need to make a sales call. Please?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [on phone, whispering] Am I the 107th caller?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [to Roy in Jim's earshot] ...back so soon.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: We can go back in, like, a couple of weeks maybe.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, right.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Okay, maybe another month, like, maybe for, like President's Day or something.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, that's right. We could do a three-day weekend. I wonder if I could, like, call in sick on the Friday. Then I get a four-day weekend.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: [to unseen co-worker] But it's so weird to fall asleep. And I just hate it. 'Cause I try to go to bed at, like, 9:30.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [to Roy as Jim escapes into bathroom] Are you kidding?

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hi, guys.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: We haven't finished getting things in order from your last visit.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm just walking around.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Were you?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: It's just that we're really swamped over here, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, and I'm not? Why would you say that? Because I'm having fun? You guys just are workin' for the weekend, aren't you? I'm workin' for the week. Sales team, listen to me. This is what we're gonna do. I'm gonna up the ante a little bit literally. Right here, I'm gonna put a crisp one hundred dollar bill. The person with the most sales at the end of the day gets to keep the cash. Sound good?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [counting cash] Seventy, eighty, one, two three. Eighty-three dollars. Still a lotta money and I'm going to ... [moves money after seeing workmen walk by] ... I'm gonna leave it right over here where everybody can see it. I will be taking Jim's clients today because he is not here and out of sight, out of the contest. Let's see who winds up with the cash, shall we?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: You're gonna compete against us?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, it is on, Phyllis, it is so on!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It is so on!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: God, this is gonna be fun.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Michael is gonna wipe the floor with us!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [on phone] So you have 40 boxes going out, and I will deliver those personally in a Sebring. Very good, nice doing business with you. Thank you. [hangs up] Yes! [chuckles] Oh, yeah! Read it and weep. Oh! Oh, look at that! [puts post-it on Phyllis' forehead] Look at me, Phyllis! Oh, what is that? That's my sale! [humming then dancing victoriously]

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: [walking by with new carpet] What... What's that? Whatcha doing?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [stops dance] Nothing.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: [laughing] I think he's dancing.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. Just ...

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: That was definitely not dancing.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know what, guys? It's none of your concern. It was official business, so just...

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Paper business.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, paper business. Is this done?

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Nope.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Extreme Home Makeover puts together a house in an hour. If you were on that crew, you would be fired like that. [snaps]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Somebody did something bad to Michael's carpet. Maybe that's all we need to know.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: [to Oscar] Who do you think did it?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Are you kidding? I thought it was you.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Really? I thought you. [both laugh in Michael's earshot]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: This was no act of God. A person did this. A person who works in this office. Maybe all of them.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know what? Today is not a good day for a sales contest. We're... we're not... we're not doin' this today.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: That doesn't seem fair.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You wanna talk about fair? Does anyone need to smell my old carpet? You explain to me how that was fair, and I'll explain to you how this is fair. Plus I just... I think that picking today was sort of taking advantage.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: But you're the one who picked today.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I am a victim of a hate crime. Stanley knows what I'm talkin' about.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: That's not what a hate crime is.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well I hated it! A lot! Okay, I... you know what? If the guilty person would just come forward and take their punishment, we'd be done . [no one comes forward] Very well. Then you are all punished.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What's our punishment?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You're all on a time out. Just sit there quietly. [phone rings, Phyllis reaches to answer] No. NO! [phone continues to ring]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey!

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: What's up?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nothing much. Let me ask you something. It's actually little awkward.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What do you think of Kelly?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I don't know. Depends if you like a little junk in ... [notices camera] Umm... She's really cool.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Are you interested in her?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yeah, totally.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Did she say something?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: She said lots of things.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Do you know if she's looking for a long-term thing or if she'd be cool just hangin' out?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I have no idea.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Can you find out?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah. Sure.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: [to Jim] Oh, long-term, definitely. Fall in love, have babies, spend every second together... but don't tell him that, okay? Just tell him I'm, like, up for anything. I mean, I'm not a slut, but who knows?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Do you remember Ed Truck?

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Sure. He hired me. How's he doing?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: How would I know?

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: I thought you might.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: My biggest fear is turning into him.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Michael, you should have much bigger fears than that.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [sighs] I wasn't talking literally, Creed. Yeah, being buried alive would be worse. Happy? Why am I talking to you?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [meeting Ed Truck in parking lot] Ed? Hi. Thanks for meeting me. Must be kinda neat comin' back.

Quote.Speaker: Ed
Quote.Text: Yeah. Should we go upstairs?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Uh, well, honestly Ed, I really don't wanna be up there right now.

Quote.Speaker: Ed
Quote.Text: So, what's the problem with my pension?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, no, no, no. You're good. It was clerical. You're good. Um, well, somebody did something in my office, and I now think that they did it on purpose and it was directed at me.

Quote.Speaker: Ed
Quote.Text: Well, what was done?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I didn't get a good look at... it, but it smells horrible.

Quote.Speaker: Ed
Quote.Text: Yeah, somebody once did that in my office.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Ed
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, that figures. So how did you deal with people not liking you?

Quote.Speaker: Ed
Quote.Text: You can't expect to be friends with everybody.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well... s-sure I can.

Quote.Speaker: Ed
Quote.Text: No. They'll always think of you as a boss first.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Not necessarily. You can love a boss like you do a father.

Quote.Speaker: Ed
Quote.Text: I'm not sure that ever happens.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, okay. Different management styles.

Quote.Speaker: Ed
Quote.Text: Why can't your workers be your workers, family be your family, your friends be your friends?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Last week I would have given a kidney to anyone in this office. I would have reached right into my stomach and pulled it out for them. But now, no. I don't have the relationship with these people that I thought I did. I hope they ask, so they can hear me say, "Uh... no. I only give my organs to my real friends. Go get yourself a monkey kidney."

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [on phone] Hey, Brenda. This is, uh, Jim Halpert from the boat. And I got your number from the corporate directory and, well, I was assuming that you probably gave it to them because you wanted me to ask you out, right? Um, so gimme a call back. You can get my number from said directory, um, or just check your e-mail 'cause I just sent you one. Yikes. Uh... give me a call back, I hope. I'll talk to you later. Bye.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: You just asked a girl out on the phone!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yep.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [on phone] Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Todd Packer
Quote.Text: Hello, yes. I'm looking for a gay nerd named Michael Scott.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Who is this? How did you get this number?

Quote.Speaker: Packer
Quote.Text: Your mom, you gay nerd!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh my God. Packer. Packster. Whacky Pack. How you doin'?

Quote.Speaker: Todd Packer
Quote.Text: Hey, did you get that package I left for you?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Uh... no. Did anybody see a package here today? No. How big was it?

Quote.Speaker: Todd Packer
Quote.Text: It was pretty big.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Todd Packer
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Did you see a big package? Where did you leave it?

Quote.Speaker: Packer
Quote.Text: Left it in the middle of your office.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Really? Guys, did you see a big package in my office?

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: You mean the thing?

Quote.Speaker: Packer
Quote.Text: [laughs uproariously]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Are you kidding me? Oh!

Quote.Speaker: Packer
Quote.Text: Special delivery!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That was Packer! Oh, you're... you are dead. You are dead, my friend! That is hilar... Oh, God! Of course it was you.

Quote.Speaker: Packer
Quote.Text: Sit on the throne, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh. [laughs and claps] Yeah, yeah! Oh my God. It was Packer!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It takes an advanced sense of humor. I don't expect everybody to understand. It was done out of love, just like I thought. It's ah... God, these people are so... these are good people. We have fun. [giggles] We just have fun! Oh, I'm just so sorry that I threw the thing out.

Quote.Speaker: Jim's voicemail
Quote.Text: You have seven unheard messages.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [voicemail message for Jim] Hey, Jim. It's Pam. I keep looking up to say something to you and then Michael's there and it's horrible. Anyway, I'm bored. Come back!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [voicemail message for Jim] Hey, guess what? I moved my computer so I can't see Michael's head. It's working. I think I can have a career as a very specific type of decorator.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [voicemail message for Jim] Sudoku. Level moderate. 18 minutes. Suck on that, Halpert.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [voicemail message for Jim] I'll transfer you. Dunder Mifflin, this is Pam. Hold, please. Dunder Mifflin, this is ... okay, sorry. Michael was standing at my desk, and I needed to be busy or who knows what would've happened, so thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [voicemail message for Jim] Hey, what's that word we made up when you have a thing stuck in your shoe? Anyway, I have a thing stuck in my shoe.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [voicemail message for Jim] Hey, I have a chance to sneak out of here early, and I'm not messing this up, so I'll see you tomorrow.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [voicemail message for Jim] Calling from my cell phone. I don't know if you guys figured out who did that to Michael's carpet yet, but I have a theory that involves an inter-departmental conspiracy. Everybody in the office. We need to talk.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I think this whole disaster on Michael's carpet happened for a good reason. Him sitting next to me is a huge gift. This girl I know would say that it was a gift from God, but I don't know about all that.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Obviously, this was Kevin. This is his sense of humor exactly.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: There are so many people with motives, even me. Almost everyone is a suspect. Whoever did this is a genius. [laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: That looks, cool, where is that?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: That hotel, it looks so romantic.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, just somewhere in the Poconos. I was just surfing.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I went with my parents to the Shadowbrook Farm once. That was also really romantic. Oh, my God, I wish a boy would take me there. I would need a fun new top. You know what a great color is on me? Lavender, actually.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Just give me one second. I'm just gonna grab something to eat.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So, you used to share that cubicle with Kelly, right?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Mmm-hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: And then you just changed desks, right?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: To one without a cubicle.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So, you just couldn't take it anymore, huh?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: What are you talking about?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So, that's how it's gonna be.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Honestly, I don't even hear her anymore. It's like waves crashing against the beach.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [on the phone] Okay, that quantity of cotton fiber will cost you... my screen disappeared. I know. I will click on the bottom and... Yes. I'm getting one of those little hourglass things. Used to have a price chart on the wall, now it's a little hourglass thing with an arrow next to it. Now it's just an hourglass thing. Uh-huh, yeah, well, or I can call you back. Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [on the phone] Excellent, good, good. Well, our truck is going out first thing tomorrow morning. So...

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: ...cases of typical format and coated white paper. Okay, thanks again so much. All right, bye-bye.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: 20 cartons of it's coming, on it's way.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What's going on? Anything here?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, yes. What yes? A sale or a lead or...

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: A sale.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ah. Small?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Big.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Huge?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Just big.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Would you say the sale that I made earlier was huge or...

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Big.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [on the phone] Good. No, I completely understand, times are a little tight right now. If it's alright with you though, I will just give you a call back next month. Great, thank you so much. Goodbye.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What was that?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You call that a sales call? My God, what have they been teaching you?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You're the one who trained me, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, well, did I teach you to roll over like a submissive dog?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You most certainly did not.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, I did not.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What can I do better?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Exactly, ask me, which you did, so, tell a joke.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm not good at jokes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Do you know a joke?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: My cousin Mose told me a joke.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Call a client right now.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And tell him the joke.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I will.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Strike while the iron's hot. A joke always works.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [on the phone] Yes, Howard Gruber, please.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Just sell it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [on the phone] Howard, hello. Dwight Schrute. Dunder Mifflin. Yes, and you are my favorite client. Listen, I'm calling you to tell you a little joke. What is black and white and red and can't think? A nun who has a beet for a head. ... No, I'm Catholic, too.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Give me the phone.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [on the phone] I understand.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Give me the phone.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [on the phone] If I was offensive in any way, I...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Tell him. Tell him that your supervisor is on the line.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [on the phone] Humor works in...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: The old one two. Let's do it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [on the phone] ...crazy ways. I'm going to pass you off to my supervisor. Hold on one second. [whispering] Howard Gruber. It's Howard Gruber.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [on the phone] Hey Howard. Michael Scott here. Yeah, sorry about that. Dwight is an idiot. I know. No, he's a little... Little dim. He's the janitor's brother, so...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That's not true.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [on the phone] Uh-huh? Yeah. Well, you know, like in a fast food restaurant, just to be nice they hire somebody who can't even find their way to work? That is Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [whispering] He's my best customer.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [on the phone] What can we do to help you out? You know what? I have a discount. Today and today only, on lightweight copier paper.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: But that's my sale. This is my sale, Michael!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [on the phone] Uh-huh, yes, I can do that. Absolutely! Perfect. Oh, I'm glad it timed out that way.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What Michael doesn't understand is that when I worked in the fast food industry I was actually commended by management for the three "M"s. McService, McCompetence and McPunctuality.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: [laughing] You gotta drink on that one. Too bad.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Hell yeah, yeah, yeah. Mo'fo, mo'fo.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: You ready?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Mmm-hmm. [thumping] [Roy groaning] Now you've got to drink.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay, look, I know what you're gonna say. That I'm not standing up for myself. But you know what? It's complicated and I really don't appreciate all the badgering.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: You could out-sell Michael any day.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I really thought these people were my friends. My best friend since kindergarten, Elliot, that's a friend. Best friend ever. I should call him. Wonder where he lives.
